Name:
HMS Peony
Sachtouris
Builder: Harland and Wolff, Belfast, Northern Ireland
Out of service:
Transferred to the Royal Hellenic Navy in 1943
September 1951
Reinstated: Returned to the Royal Navy in September 1951
Propulsion:
Two fire tube boilers
One 4-cycle triple expansion steam engine
Single shaft
Range: 3,500 nmi (6,500 km; 4,000 mi) at 12 knots (22 km/h; 14 mph)
Armament:
1 × BL 4 in (102 mm) Mk IX gun
2 × .50 cal machine gun twin machine guns
2 × 0.303 in Lewis machine guns
2 × stern depth charge racks with 40 depth charges
